lines.content: Echo is a desktop app for managing tasks, optimized for use via a Command
Line Interface (CLI). In addition to tracking tasks and deadlines, Echo
allows users to mark tasks as completed.
Adds a task with no deadline or timeframe. Indicated by [T] in the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a deadline to complete the task by. Indicated by [D] in the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a timeframe (e.g. an event with start and end time).
Indicated by [E] in the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Displays a list of all tasks added, and their respective task types and
* Task types are shown as [T], [D], or [E]
* Completion status are indicated by [ ] for incomplete tasks, or [X] for
completed tasks. Task completion status are displayed next to task types.
Marks a specified task as completed. Indicated by an [X] next to the task
* Marks the task at the specified `INDEX` as completed. `INDEX` refers to
index number shown in the displayed task list.
Task has been marked as done:
Marks a specified task as incomplete. Indicated by a [ ] next to the task
* Unmarks the task at the specified `INDEX` as completed. `INDEX` refers to
index number shown in the displayed task list.
Task has been marked as incomplete:
Deletes the specified task from the task list.
* Deletes the task at the specified `INDEX` as completed. `INDEX` refers to
index number shown in the displayed task list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds all tasks that descriptions contains any of the given keywords.
* The search is case-insensitive. (e.g. `HOMEWORK` will match `homework`)
* The order of the keywords matters. (e.g. `lab project` will **not** match with `project lab`)
* Only the task description will be searched
* Partial words can be matched. (e.g. `a` will return all tasks with description containing
* Matching tasks will be returned in a list.
Echo's data are saved in the hard disk automatically after any command that updates
the data. Echo also automatically loads previously saved data from the hard disk, or
creates a new file to store the data if one does not exist. There is no need for the
user to load or save data manually.
* Exception thrown when a user provides input that does not match the expected format.
* Exception thrown when user input is invalid.

* Creates the necessary files if they do not exist and ensures task data persistence.

* Initializes the file path to save tasks and attempts to load the save file
* if it already exists. If the file does not exist, it will create a new one.
* @param taskManager The TaskManager instance that manages tasks.

* @throws FileNotFoundException If the save file is not found.

* Manages user input by parsing commands and calling the corresponding actions.
* This class determines the appropriate command to run based on the given input.
* Continuously reads user input and processes commands.
* The loop terminates when the user inputs the "bye" command.
* - mark <task number>: Marks a task as complete.
* - unmark <task number>: Marks a task as incomplete.
* - find <description>: Searches and returns a list of all tasks containing the description.
* Any invalid input will result in an exception, which is caught and printed.
throw new InvalidInputException("Please try again with one of the valid commands:\nlist, todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark, delete, find, bye");
System.out.println("Invalid input: Please enter a valid number.");
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A Deadline task includes a description and a due date/time.
* Creates a new Deadline task with the given description and due date/time.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by The due date/time of the task.
* Represents an event task with a specific start and end time.
* An Event task includes a description, a start time, and an end time.
* Creates a new Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* A task can be marked as complete or incomplete.
* Creates a new task with the given description.
* By default, the task is set to incomplete.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* "X" represents a completed task, while " " represents an incomplete task.
* @return "X" if the task is completed, otherwise " ".
return (isCompleted ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Represents a Todo task, which is a basic task with only a description.
* A Todo does not have a deadline or a specific time associated with it.

* Manages tasks by storing, updating, and removing them.
* Provides functionality to add, mark, unmark, find, and delete tasks.
* Tasks can be of type Todo, Deadline, or Event.

* If no tasks are present, a message indicating that no tasks have been added will be shown.
* Marks a task as complete based on the provided task number.
* @param line The input line containing the command, expected to be in the format: "mark <task number>"
* @throws NumberFormatException If the task number is not a valid integer.
* @throws InvalidInputException If the input is invalid or the task number is out of range.
public void markTaskAsComplete(String line) throws NumberFormatException, InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Please enter a valid input. Use the format: mark <task number>");
int taskNumber = getTaskNumber(line, "Please enter a valid input. Use the format: mark <task number>");
ui.printMarkAndUnmark(taskList, taskNumber, "Task has been marked as done:");
* Marks a task as incomplete based on the provided task number.
* @param line The input line containing the command, expected to be in the format: "unmark <task number>"

* @throws InvalidInputException If the input is invalid or the task number is out of range.
public void markTaskAsIncomplete(String line) throws NumberFormatException, InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Please enter a valid input. Use the format: unmark <task number>");
int taskNumber = getTaskNumber(line, "Please enter a valid input. Use the format: unmark <task number>");
ui.printMarkAndUnmark(taskList, taskNumber, "Task has been marked as incomplete:");

* Adds a Deadline task to the task list.

public void addDeadline(String line) throws IllegalFormatException, InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Please enter a valid input. Use the format: deadline <description> /by <date>");

* Adds an Event task to the task list.
* @param line The input line containing the command, description, and time range.
* @throws IllegalFormatException If the event format or time range is invalid.
public void addEvent(String line) throws IllegalFormatException, InvalidInputException {
throw new InvalidInputException("Please enter a valid input. Use the format: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
String[] splitLine = line.split("/from", 2);  // Split into two parts: description and time range
throw new IllegalFormatException("Invalid event format. Please use the format: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
String[] timeRange = splitLine[1].split("/to", 2);  // Split the time range by "/to" to get the start and end time
throw new IllegalFormatException("Invalid event time format. Please use the format: /from <start> /to <end>");
